meanings.definition: To prepare food, especially potatoes, by pressing through a ricer to create a fine texture.
meanings.sent1: She riced the potatoes for the creamy mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent2: Mom riced the potatoes to make them smooth for the soup.
meanings.sent3: The chef riced the potatoes so well, they felt like clouds in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The riced potatoes were as fluffy as freshly fallen snow.
meanings.sent5: Ricing the potatoes turned them into a velvety delight.

meanings.definition: To modify a car by adding performance-enhancing features.
meanings.sent1: He riced up his car with a new exhaust system.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic riced the car to make it faster on the track.
meanings.sent3: Adding a spoiler really riced up the car's look.
meanings.sent4: The riced car zoomed down the road like a rocket.
meanings.sent5: Ricing the car gave it a turbocharged boost.

meanings.definition: To defeat an opponent in a race by a large margin.
meanings.sent1: She riced past her competitors to win the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The athlete riced to victory in the sprint race.
meanings.sent3: He riced ahead so fast, it was like he had wings on his feet.
meanings.sent4: The champion riced through the finish line like a lightning bolt.
meanings.sent5: Ricing to the finish line, she left everyone in the dust.
